body: This is causing minor issues for us migrating to version of Netty that included the commit associated with PR https://github.com/netty/netty/pull/7500. Those problems include killing connections in production (relatively infrequent, but happens enough to be noticed) and some failing tests. We can work around it by validating headers before they are sent to the peer or disabling validation but ideally the receiving end, which should do this validation regardless to adhere to the spec, only needs to do it and behave correctly.
@bryce-anderson just to double check, the spec says we should send an RST?  I agree that seems reasonable.

+1

> Am 22.06.2018 um 16:46 schrieb Eric Anderson <notifications@github.com>:
> 
> Stream-level PROTOCOL_ERROR seems good.
> 
> â€”
> You are receiving this because you commented.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub, or mute the thread.

I'm happy to work on this and I think we have two options.

1. We can leave validation in the HPACK decoder but move it to the end of the decode phase: we need to completely decode the headers to keep the HPACK state consistent.
2. We can move it clear out of the HPACK decoder (it's not really a HPACK concern) and change the API to specify if the headers belong to a request, response, or trailers.

I'd speculate that we should start with 1 and do 2 after a bit more research into the right place and how it will affect current users.

issue.title: HpackDecoder treats invalid pseudo-headers as stream level errors

repository.name: netty
repository.description: Netty project - an event-driven asynchronous network application framework

issue.body:
Motivation:

The HTTP/2 spec dictates that invalid pseudo-headers should cause the
request/response to be treated as malformed (8.1.2.1), and the recourse
for that is to treat the situation as a stream error of type
PROTOCOL_ERROR (8.1.2.6). However, we're treating them as a connection
error with the connection being immediately torn down and the HPACK
state potentially being corrupted.

Modifications:

The HpackDecoder now throws a StreamException for validation failures
and throwing is deffered until the end of of the decode phase to ensure
that the HPACK state isn't corrupted by returning early.

Result:

Behavior more closely aligned with the HTTP/2 spec.

Fixes #8043.
